item.title: Android RSPS Control
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“triger545, post:28, topic:486645”]For some reason when I compile, I get the following error.

src\server\model\players\Client.java:693: cannot find symbol symbol : class AndroidControlSession location: class server.model.players.Client for (AndroidControlSession session : AndroidControlServer.getSin gleton().getClients().keySet()) { ^ src\server\model\players\Client.java:693: cannot find symbol symbol : variable AndroidControlServer location: class server.model.players.Client for (AndroidControlSession session : AndroidControlServer.getSin gleton().getClients().keySet()) { ^ src\server\model\players\Client.java:998: cannot find symbol symbol : class AndroidControlSession location: class server.model.players.Client for (AndroidControlSession session : AndroidControlServe r.getSingleton().getClients().keySet()) { ^ src\server\model\players\Client.java:998: cannot find symbol symbol : variable AndroidControlServer location: class server.model.players.Client for (AndroidControlSession session : AndroidControlServe r.getSingleton().getClients().keySet()) { ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Chat.java:25: cannot find symbol symbol : class AndroidControlSession location: class server.model.players.packets.Chat for (AndroidControlSession session : AndroidControlServe r.getSingleton().getClients().keySet()) { ^ src\server\model\players\packets\Chat.java:25: cannot find symbol symbol : variable AndroidControlServer location: class server.model.players.packets.Chat for (AndroidControlSession session : AndroidControlServe r.getSingleton().getClients().keySet()) { ^ src\server\AndroidControlSession.java:85: incompatible types found : java.lang.String required: int switch (command) { ^ src\server\AndroidControlSession.java:189: incompatible types found : java.lang.String required: int switch (command) { ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 8 errors Press any key to continue . . .

I copied and pasted both files… I also did all of the steps in the tutorial. Help?[/quote]

You failed to import the files.

item.title: Android RSPS Control
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“gnarlycs, post:6, topic:486663”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=604881.msg4227940#msg4227940 date=1361100125]
Gnarly I need some help with mine.
I can’t get it to connect via localhost (found a program for android apps on the pc)
I tried:
/connect 127.0.0.1 1337 passhere.

Did I do it wrong? Lol.

Bugs:
If you type /connect and forget to add some details (say you leave the pass out) or you add extra characters (like {pass}) it crashes.
[/quote]

why are you using 127.0.0.1? are you trying to connect to a rsps running on your phone?[/quote]
No, on my computer lolol.
It’s on the same thing so I figured it’d still be localhost.

Edit:

Is there a way we can add our own commands?

Edit2:
Got it on port 5050 for shiggles.

Read full topic

item.title: Android RSPS Control
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“gnarlycs, post:5, topic:486663”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=604881.msg4227903#msg4227903 date=1361097594]
I’d rather not decompile the apk, just to have you update it consistently, and me have to re-decompile it each update
Plus, the only time I see it necessary for the public (so to say) to have access to a control panel as such, is to check ban messages and such. There is no need for the player to log in while on the road, if they can’t even play. Mods/Admins/Owners have a viable reason.
[/quote]

if you don’t trust me, don’t use my app???

also, you are completely missing the point of public access to the control server. it’s not meant for regular players to use (although they could if they wanted). i already gave an example for the use of this in my previous post

i made the LIST and TOTAL commands public so that you don’t need to auth to use them, this allows anyone who connects to the control server to see how many players are online and get a list of their names. this can be used for lots of things! not just my rsps control app. for example, you could have your website connect to the control server using php, get a list of online players and display it on a webpage[/quote]

Was saying re-decompile for computer use, but I think I found a app for my computer to use it on there normally.

Read full topic

item.title: Android RSPS Control
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

I’d rather not decompile the apk, just to have you update it consistently, and me have to re-decompile it each update
Plus, the only time I see it necessary for the public (so to say) to have access to a control panel as such, is to check ban messages and such. There is no need for the player to log in while on the road, if they can’t even play. Mods/Admins/Owners have a viable reason.

Read full topic

item.title: Android RSPS Control
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Fridder, post:14, topic:486645”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=604881.msg4227041#msg4227041 date=1361048876]
I’d love to use this…
But I don’t have an android.
You should make a server control panel <3
[/quote]

Decompile the APK and make it work on desktops/laptops.

Also I recommend not using this because ‘someone’ got into my server 3 minutes ago.
“Android Control session from 70.120.192.66 disconnected”
Not me. My password is lowercase + uppercase, more than 10 characters, and has numbers in it.

Also at 5:35 (EST) I got another control connection from 66.55.92.38.

This guy needs to get fucking banned.[/quote]

Decompile the APK and see if he has it set to send connections to himself or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Android RSPS Control
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“gnarlycs, post:2, topic:486663”][quote author=Fridder link=topic=604881.msg4225574#msg4225574 date=1360988305]

this is a security issue and could be exploited.

How is this a security issue?
[/quote]Its another possible way of server control. That also comes with problems such as people possibly stealing your phone, people seeing your class with the password in it, etc.

If the circumstance included a stolen phone, you could change the password as soon as you can. You could easily tweak this to encrypt the password with SHA1, MD5, or whatever suits your needs. I think this is pretty cool and I might decompile the phone-side of this to make it fit me better (change the port from ‘1337’ to anything else, add a PM/player chat/players online/whatever tab, etc).

the connect command takes a port parameter

and yes, my intentions were for people to do their own modifications and change whatever they please to fit their needs. but i must tell you, in the future i plan to add features such as the ones you listed[/quote]

Awesome, sounds good. I tried changing the port in the settings but it wouldn’t connect on my phone, so I changed it to 1337 and it worked. I guess I did something wrong.

Read full topic
